page.title: 13ECOLOGY IN GROVE PARISH.
page.content: The public footpaths in the area radiate from the village of Grove.Generally,they are well marked at their origins,but are not frequently used.No other person was ever met along their routes during the course of our survey.All were passable,but only with the use of a map and by negotiating high styles and often'mature vegetation. Rabbits,hares,foxes and field mice were regularly seen.Butterflies noted included Cabbage White,Totoise Shell,Red Admiral and Small Heath.Swallows,crows barn owls, sparrows,pigeons,and cuckoos were observed.Castle Hill wood attracted much of this animal life.This small mount,just north of the village is belived to have been occupied by the Roman military.Adjacent is the Anglian Water Authority local reservoir.
